Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel next to the 76 strip”
Reviews.Author: cford624
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a weekend. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was treated like I was their most important guest. This hotel is a block from the Titanic and Hollywood Museum. It close to any show or tourist stop. My kids enjoyed the pool. Everything was clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Wearj1
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered a great location and value. For the most part the hotel was clean but the elevator smelled horrible and the rooms were not as clean as they could have been. The room smelled a little musty and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, free breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: sjensen81
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Fairfield Inn. Very guiet, but right off of 76 (the main street). Staff was very helpful and courteous. For those who will be spending time out seeing Branson, but needing a good comforable place to crash, this hotel fits the bill. (They were doing some remodeling while we were there but it was not a problem at all). No fitness center (maybe that was the remodeling they were doing....)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: CnBCampbell
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! If you are planning on spending the day in your room and want to be pampered with service and luxury then this is not the place for you. If, on the other hand, you are looking for a decent place to sleep that is close to everything then this is it. My family spends very little time in the room, we are always out enjoying Branson. We stay here for free using Marriott points and love that it is located right next to Walgreens.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Sharon H
Reviews.Content: They were on the brink of a much needed total renovation when we stayed a couple days during the 4th of July holiday. The staff was super nice and helpful. Breakfast was outstanding - biscuits, gravy, waffles, fresh fruit, oatmeal, pastries and breads, plentiful juice and coffee. This is the lower end of the Marriott properties so keep that in mind with the room aesthetics. Can't wait to see mthe remodeled version! It would have been about 25% cheaper by any other name. Very close to everything we wanted to do, except the Landing. Oh, and for runners and bicyclists, I went for a run early one morning and it was very safe with nice sidewalks and many others out for exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynnestephens
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Close to the attractions we wanted to see. Very clean and staff were helpful and very nice. Breakfast was good and my kids enjoyed swimming in the pool. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “review of fairfield inn, branson, mo”
Reviews.Author: daddygolf
Reviews.Content: fairfield was nice, althought I usually stay @ hampton inn by hilton; the hotel overall was nice, but not as nice as a hampton; lobby much smaller, breakfast items not quite as nice hampton, but the price we paid was a bit lower that what we had found for a hampton; Overall I was quite happy and fairfield inn was @ the tail end of the strip, but right near most of the attractions we had picked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay . The staff was friendly, and it was a very clean hotel. Would stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our one night stay”
Reviews.Author: vb22
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Fairfield Inn Branson on a partial cross country trip. First time in Branson - wasn't what we expected (of the town, that is!). The town sprawls out along the top of several hills. There was still quite a lot of damage from the major tornado of 29 Feb 2012. It doesn't appear that the Fairfield Inn was affected. Looking up the street address for this property we ended up on the wrong side of the major highway through town. You have to take the street in the opposite direction from the Titanic - not sure what street address would work. We had to call the hotel as none of our GPS's were right! Front desk staff were extremely helpful. We had hoped for a top floor room but they were not available as the hotel was swapping out mattresses and they weren't putting guests on the floors where work was in progress. Although the hotel didn't seem old by any means there's evidence that the owners continue to invest in it. I'd rate this better than the average Fairfield Inn. Plenty of free parking right around the hotel - we were able to almost park outside our room albeit there were still stairs due to the hilly terrain. The front desk staff have quite a few handouts with info on attractions and shows and they can also assist with these if you'd like. Overall I'm surprised this hotel is currently ranked #54 out of all hotels in Branson. Since its my first time to stay in Branson I don't have familiarity with other properties - but as a frequent Marriott guest I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very cramped restroom”
Reviews.Author: stubbornme
Reviews.Content: This will be my first unsuperior review. The bathroom is soooo small you have to stand in front of the toilet to close the door. You have to close the door to get in the shower because the door blocks half the shower. The toilet blocks the other half. If you were going to see Clay Cooper, the location would be perfect, but for 80.00, I'd like to be able shower

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Des Moines, Iowa, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DiamondOrtiz
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Fairfield Inn, the price was great but the location was the best thing for us. We walked to the Titanic, Ripley's believe it or not, and the Wax museum. They are all within half a mile from the hotel. The breakfast was very good, not your typical free breakfast. They had biscuits and gravy, waffles, fruits, yogurt, etc. The housekeeping did a great job of cleaning the room when we would leave and always very friendly. The pool was small but with two young boys we didn't really need anything big or deep. The only issue with the pool is that it had a lot of chlorine In it but that's how they keep it clean I guess. I would recommend this hotel to someone who doesn't want to spend too much on a room, wants prime location (close to everything) and wants free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Louisianagirl60
Reviews.Content: We went to Branson for 4 days and the Fairfield Inn was Great. Good location and great service. It was very clean and the Breakfast was better than most. We would stay again. Whatever we ask for, we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great room. Great breakfast. Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: janetfromkc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fairfield this past weekend and had a great time. Very clean, friendly and the best hotel breakfast in Branson!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonder place”
Reviews.Author: Scuba132
Reviews.Content: The service was great, and friendly too. My room was awful clean, and my bed was comfortable. Plenty if towels, and the maid service was also excellent. The breakfast buffet was plenty of food. The swimming pool was clean, and not a lot chemicals. The hot tub was very relaxing. The price was good too. If I needed directions, they were happy to help. I would be more than happy to stay then again..

Reviews.Title: “Great, convenient place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jcb2282
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly, and the check in was fast and easy. I loved the location right off of the strip. The hotel is right across from the Titantic museum. Our room and the hotel were clean and in good condition. The indoor pool is pretty shallow (goes up to 4 1/2 feet), but we enjoyed the pool and hot tub. Breakfast was good and it was well stocked. They have a good variety of food including Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches and a variety of yogurt, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not great not bad.”
Reviews.Author: oktravel500
Reviews.Content: Room clean but could have been better. Room needed to be updated and felt old. Staff were friendly. Ok for the AAA rate paid.

Reviews.Title: “It was adequate.”
Reviews.Author: Wowx3
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here the past couple of times we have been to Branson. Loved the location and the ease of getting to Silver Dollar city, good shopping and good food. However, this time the hotel staff was never at the desk the three or four times I needed some assistance. When I asked about the location of the "Laundry room" which was on the hotel map in the rooms, I was informed, rather curtly, that they don't offer one of those. I guess I misunderstood that was for the hotel's laundry. The A/C in the room was very loud and cycled on and off all night never stopping. It was an adequate hotel for the amount that I paid but I do think I will be researching more options for a hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Christie592
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Fairfield Inn multiple times. I have yet to have a bad experience. The desk staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are neat and clean. Beds are very comfortable and there are 10, yes I said 10, pillows in each room. No need to run back and forth to the desk for pillows. Overall, great experience. Will continue to stay here on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location”
Reviews.Author: ksgirl3
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing I can say is the elevator smelled. Otherwise no problems. The rooms were clean, the employees were very nice, cheerful and helpful. It's very convenient and easy to get in and out of. Walgreen's is next door which made it nice if you leave some things at home - like I did. Beds were comfortable. They offered a continental breakfast however we are big breakfast lovers and we always look for best breakfast locations, so we did not take advantage of their buffet on this particular trip. Many people took advantage of this service though. They had a nice pool and spa, but again we did not take advantage of it this trip. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Thefunny
Reviews.Content: Good location on 76. Walgreens next door and not far from outlet stores or water park. Rooms seemed a little old/dated but may just be me. Breakfast was good and the indoor pool area served its purpose. Would stay here again given the inexpensive rate I got.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location!”
Reviews.Author: robyn l
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the 2011 summer and again around NY's Eve 2011 into 2012...I can say there has been a significant improvement in the staff's helpfulness on our 2nd stay. When we asked for directions or a recommendation for something to do- the staff at the front desk were very quick to offer suggestions! The breakfast ran low one morning and the front desk staff didn't hesitate to restock the items needed...he didn't act put out when asked...he did his job w/ a smile. I really appreciated that kindness. When we needed more towels in our rom, the housekeeper on our floor was very quick to fill our needs and again with a smile. The pool area was clean...too many people in there for me to actually go swimming but the area itself was clean and the pool was CLEAR. I would definitely stay there again w/ my family. The rooms are a little dated in their decor...but you get a mini fridge and microwave in the room (NICE feature) and the beds are comfortable...not as firm as I normally like, but much better than other older hotels I've stayed in before. FLUFFY pillows were very nice to snuggle into after a tiring day too.

Reviews.Title: “Old, but clean”
Reviews.Author: SBluv2rvl
Reviews.Content: Great location, right off the main drag, past the "Titanic." Very friendly staff and quick check-in. Old hotel, but rooms clean and comfortable, quiet. We stayed the night before New Year's Eve and it was packed; we had to park in the back. There is an entrance door there that opens with the room key. We couldn't get wi-fi to work; could have been our laptop, but no problems with it prior. Since we had one evening in Branson, we wanted to make the most of it. Stopping at an information center was very helpful. We learned that after the New Year's weekend, things pretty much come to a halt for Jan. and Feb. and start to resume slowly in March. There's a brand new section by downtown Branson, called Branson Harbor, I believe. Just head for the water past downtown and you'll see a new outdoor mall. There's free parking. Being Christmas time, there was a huge Christmas tree in the center and lots of decorations. Even without that, it's very pretty. There's dancing waters with fire, to music, and lots of open seating to sit and watch. We were told there's over 100 merchants, including restaurants, and several new small businesses. Seems to be something for everyone. Again at Christmas time, the Lights at Shephard Hills, are not to be missed. This is where you drive your vehicle through 2 1/2 miles of animated decor. It's pricey and per person, not per carload, but your ticket also includes going up the tower to see 360 degrees of the area and a free hot chocolate or cider at a nearby giftshop. Took us 1 1/2 hrs. there. Festive and nice! Not sure if the breakfast had the pancake maker, as I'm a fruit and yogurt eater. The raisins, nuts and brown sugar are great extras. No check-out for us, since we request the bill to be slipped beneath our room door during the night. We'll definitely be back to Branson. We had a great discount through "family and friends" and we are Marriott fans. And though everything was good, including customer service, I hate to admit that we would perhaps shop around for a more updated hotel...with a comparative cost of course. Though I rated these specific items high, I gave it "average" overall, because of the update.

Reviews.Title: “Great locataion”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean & comfortable. The hotel was quiet, pool and jacuzzi were clean and the breakfast had lots of choices. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: billarsenault
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and comfortable. The hotel was quiet, pool and jacuzzi were clean and the breakfast had lots of choices. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly folks”
Reviews.Author: JGrits1948
Reviews.Content: Old and in need of an update. I stay here on business trips and even with all the tourist traffic, they always have time to help.

Reviews.Title: “Clean average Fairfield Inn”
Reviews.Author: Luv2explore72
Reviews.Content: I stay frequently at hotels for business and leisure so I feel my perspective comes from experience. This Fairfield is slightly better than the average Fairfield. The room was clean and bed was comfy. Great location right off the strip. The room was sparse with amenities, however. Our standard room did not come with a fridge or microwave. :( And the decorations seemed a bit "plain jane". Also, no fitness room (coming in a year says management). Breakfast was typical for Fairfield and room was kept clean. Overall, a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Price”
Reviews.Author: Vicki951
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, great price, great, breakfast. We had a great time at the pool and hot tub. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff needs to be retrained.”
Reviews.Author: larkspur725
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at this hotel for four nights through Marriott.com. I was taking a trip with my mother, who has had double knee replacements. Therefore, I requested a handicapped accessible room. I saw on the website that a handicapped accessible room could not be guaranteed, so, about a week before the stay, I called the property to make sure that this was available. Front desk staff said that it wouldn't be a problem. Cut to day of arrival. We get to hotel. We're on the third floor. We go to the room. The bathroom gave new meaning to the term "water closet." It was by no means handicapped accessible. I go back to the front desk, indicating that there was a problem because I requested a handicapped room, called to see if one was available, and was told it would be and now it wasn't. The front desk staffer seemed overwhelmed because a tour bus arrived right before we did---I guess we know who took the handicapped room that *I* requested. He checked to see if another room was available, but never ONCE did he apologize for the misunderstanding--even when I said that now I'd have to drive all up and down Hwy. 76 to try and find another room to fit our needs. I work in retail and this kind of treatment is unacceptable. You go above and beyond to make it right. This staffer, Chris, did not. He acted like he could really care less if I cancelled the reservation. I've stayed at other Marriott properties in the region and enjoyed being there, but I'll never stay at this property. I'll give my money to the Best Western across the street, who was more than happy to go out of their way to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Member with Aweful experience during and after, would never go back!”
Reviews.Author: MHNOK
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for three nights. First night was fine and seemed like a nice hotel. Then we go out to enjoy the town and come back around 1030pm and our room was messy with only the beds made. No new shampoo or bathroom needs, no trash taken out, no vacuuming, dirty tub and toilet. We called the front desk and told them the state of the room and they said they were sorry and they would notify housekeeping and it will not happen again. We then asked for bathroom needs that we didn't get and they say they had no one extra on staff at that time to bring it to us that we would have to come get it ourselves at the front desk. We arrive at the front desk and there are two young ladies sitting there just shooting the breeze, makes me think if the statement no one available was true or not. Then out on the town a second day and come back to a room of the same terrible state as the night before but this time the beds are made with the same dirty linens that were sleep and ate in the night before with crumbs and stains still on the sheets and pillows. We called the front desk to tell them the state of the room and ask for someone to come up and make up our beds and clean our room but they stated no one was there that could do that and they could give us the linens to CLEAN OUR OWN ROOM AND MAKE OUR OWN BEDS. We showed the girl who brought our linens our room in its dirty state and she apologized and the front desk lady says she would leave a note for the manager. The assistant manager took our case over not letting us deal with the general manager. We were very unhappy how he handle our situation and how he told us one thing and then change his mind and decide to do something else. Then procedes to tell us to call Marriott Corp. and gives us the number to call. Then we were unhappy how Marriott Corp. decided to go with the hotel saying they are happy with how the hotel handled it and go with what they decide and sorry if this upsets us. I am a Elite Gold Member with Marriott and have worked for Marriott in my Past and I am totally shocked on all this and want to warn you this his how they treat me, How will they treat you? I recommend no one stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location near Titanic Attraction”
Reviews.Author: kathy884
Reviews.Content: This property has a great location, right next to Walgreens, right off of the main drag, very near the Titanic museum (the attraction we wanted to be close to). We thought this property was a little nicer than the Best Western Center Pointe Inn, a property right across the street that we stayed at on our last Branson trip. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, everything was bright, and there was a small pool and hot tub. In general, this was a perfectly fine place, but not exceptional and not as nice as typical Fairfield Inns, Hampton Inns, and Hilton Garden Inns we have stayed in (a step below most of these). I'm not a big fan of breakfasts at these kinds of places, but what made this better than most of these was the exceptional woman who worked the breakfast. She made sure everything was clean, made sure to stock more items whenever items were low, and had a great friendly attitude. The one thing the Center Pointe Inn has that this place doesn't are mini refrigerators and microwaves in the room. On a longer stay, I might pick the Best Western to have this. If that is not imporatant to you however, I would pick this place over the Best Western Centerpoint Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Average Fairfield Inn”
Reviews.Author: mary2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location for the shows and attractions. You can tell it is an older Fairfield Inn, but clean. The beds were pretty comfortable. The breakfast was average with cereal, waffles, fruit, toast, bagels, yogurt, milk and juice. They have an indoor pool and spa that is pretty small.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Marriott Property”
Reviews.Author: tulsacubfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night here (we were only in town for one night). While it was not terrible, it was not up to the standard you expect (or at least we expect) from a Marriott property. Halls kind of musty smelling. Bathtub had hair in it. Staff was not rude....more of an "I'm doing my job and that's about it" attitude. My husband was in the bathroom when housekeeping knocked on the door. He told them 3 times to wait a minute...the third time being as she walked in the bathroom....obviously he was not happy. The front desk, again, was not rude, but had an "oh well" attitude. Breakfast had the staples (waffle, Jimmy Dean sandwiches, cold cereal, toast, hard boiled eggs), but that was about it. Nothing wrong with what was there...just none of the "extras" you expect from a Marriott. We are Marriott members, so always stay in a Marriott property. If we are back in the area, we will probably give the Residence Inn a try. the location of this Fairfield was nice (you could take one of the alternate routes - blue I think - directly to the hotel and miss the main street traffic!), but that isn't worth staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Plain”
Reviews.Author: travelchick39
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a weekend trip with family. Price and location were the main reasons we chose this site. The rooms are no frills and could use a little updating. The bed linens had been updated but nothing else. This is a very old Fairfield Inn and very little updates are visible. The halls are dark and narrow, the elevator is small and slow. The beakfast offerings were adequate, but the breakfast room was hot and overcrowded we had to take our food to our room due to a lack of tables. I only reccomend this hotel if you get a good rate and are not looking for much. On the positive side it seemed clean - and there is an indoor pool. Also, there is free wi-fi and coffee all day.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for about $75, crowded, limited breakfast, 1st rm unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: vbrownTA
Reviews.Content: Check ac/heat in operation for objectionable odors. When we turned the heat on, the odor was horrendous, not occupiable, etc. Front desk claimed it must be because it is the first time of the fall that it has been turned on, etc and the dust etc is burning off, etc. Maybe, but it was so bad that it set off the smoke alarm, if that tells you anything. Check water temp. Able to move to a different room fairly fast, easy, etc after a pre-inspection by me. 2nd room wasn't bad for the price, if you aren't spending much time there, but shower water wasn't hot enough, although pressure and general cleanliness was ok. Sink water seemed hotter than shower/bath. Indoor pool small and didn't appear to be a very pleasant area. Free breakfast is worthless. Small breakfast area gets too crowded and offering isn't even worth your time. I recommend not counting on it, so plan accordingly. Location is pretty central for the strip, etc and maybe 10-15 mins from SDC. I expect that it's about the best you can do in Branson for around $75.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; mediocre experience”
Reviews.Author: pibi63040
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right in the middle of the Strip which is good in some ways; bad in others. This hotel has a crowded parking lot, lobby, breakfast area, very crowded elevators, etc. Very good breakfast (included) for the price but layout of dining room is awkward and uncomfortable; tables fill right away and you feel like you are in the way of other guests. Rooms just okay. Hotel feels crowded and out of date. We booked one paid night and one Marriott "reward" stay and room was not serviced. Poor communication at front desk. We are SDC season passholders -- stayed at many other area hotels --- and will probably not return, even as "reward" stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: judyw988
Reviews.Content: Very nice experience. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nites and were treated very very good. We had no complaints at all, room was clean, roomy enough, pool was GREAT and we were the only ones to use it, breakfast was plentiful and good, and the price was excellent (senior discount). Rooms are not as large as we often are used to but did not matter with such a great price. Location was on on the strip but close enough, there was a little drive to Old Main street but seeing what's on the strip each drive down was worth it. Branson is a great place and fun but unless you are a BIG show liker, it's a none return place. Loved the Fairfield...

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Toomanydaysontheroad
Reviews.Content: I had no issues. Very clean hotel, friendly staff, good breakfast (a little crowded due to the Branson tourists). Our beds were very comfortable and our room was very clean. Everything worked fine. The hotel was very quiet even though it was very close to Country Blvd. The kids loved the indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fairwayBarbie
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the friendliness of the staff. The rooms were simple, but clean and well maintained. They have an indoor pool and hot tub, which is great for those traveling with kids! The breakfast is included and it is very good. We will definitely stay there again when we return next year!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was a very good choice for our stay.”
Reviews.Author: pickyBossierCity_LA
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly. The location is great. The breakfast is excellent especially the waffle maker. Beds were very comfortable. Looking forward to staying at this hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: tsturm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our family vacation. The beds really need to be turned or something. My back hurt so bad from the beds, they are to soft and give to easy. We stayed here because it's a smoke free room, and there were no animals either. But when we got back home they were trying to charge us $250 for smoking in the room, which we did not do. When we called them about it, they told us that everyone says that. On top of all that they didn't even get our room number right. So something just doesn't sound right with this place. If we ever go back to Branson, we wont be staying here, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: threepowells
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here and the beds were extremely comfortable. The rooms could use some updating but they were fine. Breakfast was well stocked but very crowded. However, that's whats to be expected in Branson. One complaint was the pool area. The hotel was very crowded and there were lots of kids. Some of the kids were unsupervised so it was pretty chaotic. I try to stay at a Marriott property but the reason we stayed here was the Silver Dollar City package. We paid $252 for two nights and two adult tickets to SDC. Pretty good deal. However, if you don't need the package definitely shop around for lodging. There's tons of comparable places in Branson for a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: vjv2007
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of the strip. Comfortable room with a small bathroom, but we were out and about most of the time so it really didn't matter. Breakfast was good and I love the waffle maker! The pool and whirlpool were refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and great location- but...”
Reviews.Author: coastermeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in early June. The property was very clean and well maintained. The breakfast was typical of all Fairfield Inns. Our king suite w/ sleeper sofa had plenty of room for the 3 of us and all our junk. The bed was comfortable and the room furnishings were nice The location was excellent being near the intersection Hwy 76 and 165. We always request top floor rooms when we make reservations to avoid any possible noise from a room above us. We were late checking-in and were told they didn't have anything available on the top floor so we had to take a 2nd floor room. There were 2 buses of kids staying at the hotel the same nights were there and some were in the room above us. The first 2 nights the sack races it sounded like they were having above us stopped at 11:00pm and we were able to sleep. The final night however the sack races continued to midnight when I called the front desk and complained. The noise stopped until about 1:00am and then started again. We travel with ear plugs for this very reason and resorted to those for a good but short nights sleep as we were leaving early the next morning. While the hotel was nice and you can have a group of unruly kids ruin any stay we would stay here again but only if we could have a top floor room. We don't understand why so many hotels are now wood frame construction which lends itself to noise problems from the floor above.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay with great staff!! Perfect location for Branson Strip”
Reviews.Author: travelagent56
Reviews.Content: My children and I stayed at this resort for the weekend. Perfect location just off the strip, Walgreens right next door for things you forgot at home or need. Staff was very friendly and wonderful. Rooms very clean and housekeeping was great. As a travel agent, I will be coming back again, and recommending this resort to family and clients. Good job Fairfield Inn Staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable bed and great location!”
Reviews.Author: g00glybear
Reviews.Content: We didn't hang at the hotel very much because we were out shopping etc. But the staff at the front desk was very friendly and it was a speedy check in. We had 3 rooms and they were all togethter as requested. The bed and bedding seemed very luxurious compared to other hotels I have been in which was great falling into after a busy day. The location was just a few steps off the strip, I think there was just a walgreens between the hotel and strip, which was handy. Our group enjoyed the breakfast, there seemed to be more selection than at some cont. breakfasts I've been to. We enjoyed the indoor pool and hot tub, the only bad part is the chlorine was very strong, clean though.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay, wonderfully clean, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: KClady1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Fairfield last week during our childrens spring break. This was the best hotel we've ever stayed at in Branson (we usually go 2 or 3 times a year). The staff was so nice, the breakfast was very good and extensive for a Continental Breakfast. Our room, including the bathroom, was immaculate. The beds were so comfortable with loads of pillows. Our daughter took ill the night before we left, and the front desk staff was so considerate, bringing extra blankets for us, etc, very quickly. I can't say enough nice things about this location. We will definitly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place but not worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: Arkansasgirl08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here only one night. We had seen pictures and I had read good reviews....When we arrived we paid over $100 and the room was basically a $65 room. There was no microwave, fridge or hardly any space. They stuck us right beside the elevator as well and we heard all kinds of noise during the night. Needless to say, we left after that night and stayed in another hotel that was cheaper and actually had more things than this overpriced hotel. Not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: minmurphy
Reviews.Content: We stayed her back in March for 7 nights. We loved it, friendly and helpful staff and very clean rooms. We payed 55 a night, and I was kind of worried when I fist got there, but after stepping into the hotel and our room, I was at aww...We will stay there again in December!!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break at Fairfield Inn Branson”
Reviews.Author: ConwayArkTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at the Fairfield Inn Branson during the last week of March. We chose this hotel for their smoke-free policy and comments from tripadvisor contributors about mattress comfort. For the most part, it was a pleasant stay. The staff was friendly. The room was in great condition. The hotel was clean. The bed was actually comfortable. The fridge was ice cold. The a/c, heater worked great. The location was great (right next door to a 24 hour Walgreens ) Just a few negatives, not really that negative The continental breakfast was not really anything special (a few waffle irons would have helped, there was only a toaster and a microwave). One of the mornings there was no hot water (probably because we waited until all of the other spring breakers were in the shower). The biggest negative was that the hotel was painting the building for two days of our stay and we had to keep our curtains closed for privacy (this should not be a problem in a few days). Overall, this hotel should be much better than the dozens of 30 dollar motels in town and it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: belleandbeau
Reviews.Content: We just had a wonderful stay at the Fairfield Inn in Branson, MO. The hotel was clean, and check-in was fast. The hotel is in great location relative to the "alternative" routes around town (Blue, and Red rroutes). The only complaint we had was that the hotel caters to buses full of tourists which overwhelm the breakfast area and common spaces in the morning. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Wolfeaj
Reviews.Content: We had a great 2 night stay there recently. The room was clean and large enough for the 4 of us (including a play pen). It was nice to have a microwave and small refrigerator in the room. The pool area was clean and towels are provided (although the pool is a little small). Staff was nice and courteous. We will defintely go back.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED the Fairfield!”
Reviews.Author: OKCyndi
Reviews.Content: Fairfield is a great place to stay just off the main strip in Branson! We stayed with our family - and it couldn't have been better! The staff was so nice when we checked in - the room was clean and comfortable - great maid service every day we were there! The staff really went out of their way to accomodate our kids - they were just wonderful! The "continental" breakfast that was included was really good - much more than the normal doughnuts & coffee - lots to choose from! The indoor pool area was extremely clean and towels were provided. Overall a great stay - we will definitely stay again & will tell our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: bdee72211
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairfield Inn for the first time April 5 & 6, 2007 and loved it. The hotel must be very confident of their cleanliness to have white comforters on their beds. The bed was VERY comfortable for a hotel bed and we had plenty of pillows. The room was quite even though it was facing the road, but the road is not really that busy. Only a couple of blocks from Hwy 76. Very reasonably priced and friendly staff. We would stay here again. I don't know why it is only a 2 star hotel, it was worth four stars at least.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: razorback70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a snowy night in January of '07. Check-in was extremely quick, as was the automatic checkout. Hotel features a large indoor pool, hot tub, and spacious lobby. A free continental breakfast is provided. The rooms are very nice, especially for the price. Fairly roomy, with a nice desk, and plenty of lighting options. It's unusual perhaps, but I enjoy when I can have the room lit in a variety of ways, and there are several lamps you can choose from. The rooms here allow you to do that. Water pressure was great, and the room and bathroom were very clean. Bed was extremely comfortable, television was large, and had a local channel guide provided, which is always a plus. You're just off of Hwy. 76, and pretty close to a variety of shows, and close enough to some of the shopping (little ways from The Landing, I wouldn't necessarily recommend the location if you'll be frequenting that area). My wife & I were very pleased, and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bransons Best”
Reviews.Author: ourtrip2006
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I enjoyed our stay in this hotel/motel The staff were courteous and there was a front office lady from Australia who helped us with everything . We had a wonderful time and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Great Rate - Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ETsMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a one night getaway to Branson so we could take our son and his friend to Silver Dollar City to see the Christmas lights on Saturday and Christmas shopping at Branson Landing on Sunday. We checked a ton of websites and finally chose Fairfield because there are so many Mom and Pop type hotels in Branson that it's hard to know their reputation or what to expect. We've stayed at many Fairfields in the past and figured that even an average Fairfield experience would suit our purposes. (my son requested an indoor pool which also influenced our decision) So, we booked on Marriott's website and received a very good rate of $65.99 including continental breakfast. While booking on the site, we had the option to request early check-in. Upon calling the hotel the morning of our arrival we were told that our room was already available -- it was 8 o'clock in the morning! That was a first. The hotel: while it was typical of Fairfield decor and layout, there was something about it that seemed not quite up to par with Fairfield's we have visited in the past. The hottub wasn't as clean as we'd like, there wasn't any hand lotion in the rooms, the lobby was very dim--it just seemed a little on the drab side. With that being said, there were some extremely pleasant experiences. The beds were amazingly comfortable, the room itself was very clean, and the hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly. I cannot comment in the breakfast because we opted for Krisy Kreme down the street. I gave this hotel an above average rating, not becuase of the hotel itself, but because of the staff, comfort of the beds, location, and price. I would highly recommend this place for a family who will not be spending a lot of time at the hotel -- perhaps a one or two night stay. Any longer and you might want to opt for a hotel with a few more amenities. This hotel is in a great location just off 76 with a walgreens right next door. There are a lot of nearby restaurants and activities. The staff, once again, is very accomodating. I would not recommend this as a romatic escape. Given the same circumstances, we would stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn Branson
HotelInfo.Address: 220 Highway 165 South, Branson, MO 65616
